qas.question: Which company owns the rights to National Hockey League broadcasts?
Where are affiliates of HNIC aired?

answers.text: a separate CRTC-licensed part-time network operated by Rogers

qas.question: What company was purchased by the CBC in order to air the National Hockey League?
What is the most popular program that is aired by CBC-television networks?

plausible_answers.text: Rogers exercises editorial control and sells all advertising time

qas.question: Why was it necessary to the CBC to purchase Rogers Communication?
The CRTC has limited The CBC promos and other CBC television programs that can appear during which broadcast?

context: Under the CBC's current arrangement with <a0_0><b3_0>Rogers Communications<b3_0/><a0_0/> for National Hockey League broadcast rights, <b4_0>Hockey Night in Canada<b4_0/> broadcasts <a2_0>on CBC-owned stations<a2_0/> and affiliates are not technically aired over the CBC Television network, but over <a1_0>a separate CRTC-licensed part-time network operated by Rogers<a1_0/>. This was required by the CRTC as <b5_0>Rogers exercises editorial control and sells all advertising time<b5_0/> during the HNIC broadcasts, even though the CBC bug and promos for other CBC Television programs appear throughout <b6_0>HNIC<b6_0/>.
